intro: Phyllanthus austroparensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the warmer months. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Phyllanthus austroparensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
